intro: Bolbitis vivipara, commonly known as the viviparous fern, is a unique member of the fern family with distinctive botanical features. It is characterized by its creeping rhizomes that produce aerial plantlets, a trait that sets it apart from most other ferns. The plant has delicate, pinnately divided fronds that are typically light green with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions with high humidity. Its reproductive method, which involves the development of plantlets on the rhizomes, is an adaptation that enhances its ability to spread and colonize new areas.
